text: Varadis Palace (; ) is the former residence of Prince Tisavarakumarn, the Prince Damrong Rajanubhab on Lan Luang Road in Bangkok, Thailand. The palace was built in 1911 by German architect Karl Döhring during the reign of King Rama V to the reign of King Rama IV. After Prince Tisavarakumarn died at this palace on 1 December 1943, the palace was preserved by his heir Mom Rajawongse Sangkadis Diskul, former Ambassador to Malaysia, Switzerland and the Vatican and presently by his great grandson, Mom Luang Panadda Diskul, former Provincial Governor of Nakhon Pathom and Chiang Mai and a member of the House of Senate. In 1977 the palace building was renovated and converted into a museum and library.https://th.hellomagazine.com/exclusive-interviews/m-l- panadda- diskul/http://www.sac.or.th/databases/museumdatabase/en/review_inside_ByMember_Detail.php?id=121&CID;=3410 Her Royal Highness Princess Galyani Vadhana, the elder sister of Thailand's King Bhumibol presided over the Official opening ceremony on 12 September 1977.https://www.matichon.co.th/local/crime/news_1002683 The palace was awarded outstanding conservation building from The Association of Siamese Architects under the Royal Patronage of His Majesty the King in 1984. ==External links== *Bangkok Library on Varadis Palace Museum and Library *tour-bangkok-legacies.com on Varadis Palace ==References== Category:Museums in Bangkok Category:Former royal residences in Bangkok Category:Historic house museums in Thailand Category:Residential buildings completed in 1911 Category:Museums established in 1996 Category:1996 establishments in Thailand Category:ASA Architectural Conservation Award recipients Category:Art Nouveau architecture in Bangkok
